text: Ming works at the zoo. She mixes food for the chimpanzees. Ming mixes up large batches of food from sacks of high fiber food and sacks of high protein food. She uses a standard scoop and the following recipes.

Ming asks a group of visiting middle school students to help her figure out the quantities she needs to mix for the baby chimps.

  • The recipe calls for 40% high fiber food and 60% high protein food. She needs a total of 225 scoops altogether. How many scoops of each should she use?

40 High Fiber Scoops + 60 High Protein Scoops for every 100 Total Scoops

â¤¸ Ã— 2.25 â¤¸ Ã— 2.25 â¤¸ Ã— 2.25

90 High Fiber scoops + 135 High Protein scoops for every 225 total scoops

OR

60% of high protein ðŸ¡² 0.60 x 225 = 135 scoops

40% of high fiber ðŸ¡² 0.40 x 225 = 90 scoops

After mixing the baby chimp food, Ming only has 30 scoops of high protein food left.

  • She knows that high protein food has to be 40% of the adult chimp mix total. What is the total amount of food she can prepare for the adult chimps?

Divide the first ratio by 40 and then multiply the second by 30.

OR

0.40 x total amount of food = 30 scoops

30 Ã· 0.40 = 75
